greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of Ei(1)/e, where Ei is the exponential integral function.
comment: Can be considered the value of the divergent series -0! - 1! - 2! - ... ; see Lagarias reference Section 2.5. - _Harry Richman_, Jun 14 2020.
link: Jeffrey C. Lagarias, Euler's constant: Euler's work and modern developments, arXiv:1303.1856 [math.NT], 2013; Bull. Amer. Math. Soc., 50 (2013), 527-628.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Exponential Integral
formula: The real part of subfactorial(-1), that is the real part of Gamma(0,-1)/e.
xref: Cf. A000166 (subfactorials), A061382 (Pi/e, the imaginary part of subfactorial(-1)), A091725 (Ei(1)), A073003 (-exp(1)*Ei(-1)).
results.author: _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 15 2017
